Under the Image-oriented Creation of Novelty (ICON) project, PAR Government Systems Corporation (PGSC) is collaborating with a major academic institution and building a system to generate novel media and media sets that will provide a range of data to test the capability of open world AI systems. The PAR team is leveraging its decades of experience in pattern analysis and recognition across multiple data modalities, including imagery/video and natural language processing (NLP), to develop scientific techniques and measurements that will quantify and characterize novelty in the context of a set of classes. The key technical invention of this research project will be the development of a mathematical formalism to define novelty in respect to object classes that a classifier has been trained on. Participants on this project will be conducting pioneering research into understanding how to make AI/ML systems more responsive to situations that they have never encountered before.  The successful candidate will lead the data science aspects of this exciting basic research program. They will be responsible for leading key aspects of the design, deployment, and implementation of the data science aspects of the program – focusing on developing techniques to measure data uniqueness and similarity across information classes. The program will advance the state of the art in the training, testing, and evaluation of open world AI systems and the Senior Data Scientist will be working closely with leading researchers in the field.  The candidate will work closely with the Principal Investigator, software and data engineers, and data scientists on the following key tasks:   Work on the mathematical basis for the concept of novelty, as well as algorithms that can be used to evaluate the novelty of images using both image and semantic representations  Work with software developers on the project to incorporate developed algorithms into large scale prototypes  Required Skills    Methods for similarity measurement such as angular similarity/distance, graphs (measures of isomorphism), strings (Hamming distance, etc.), sets (Sørensen–Dice, etc.), and image similarity metrics (Mean Squares, Normalized Correlation, Pattern Intensity, Mutual Information, mean of absolute error distance, etc.)  Excellent communication and presentation skills, specifically able to convey technical information in a clear and unambiguous manner  Technical development skills to develop proof of concept systems.  Familiarity with machine learning techniques and the mathematics behind them.  Assisted in research projects, as well as academic collaborations  Required Experience    BS and MS in Computer Science, Mathematics, or related technical field or equivalent experience  15+ years in data science and related disciplines (10+ years with a MS Degree)  Experience in prototyping algorithms and semantic representations is preferred  Experience in prototyping with Python is required however prototyping with TensorFlow and/or mathematical modeling tools (MATLAB, Mathematica, etc) is optional  Experience with graph theories/ algorithms, CIFAR, and ImageNet will be considered  Ability to express complex technical concepts effectively, both verbally and in writing  Candidates are not required to have an active security clearance but candidate should be willing to obtain a security clearance   It is the policy of PAR to prohibit all forms of discrimination and to affirmatively implement equal opportunity to all qualified employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, age, veteran status, national origin, disability, marital status, predisposing genetic characteristics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other legally protected status and positive action shall be taken to insure the fulfillment of this policy.
